00025 // LogFileBuf
00026 class LogFileBuf : public std::streambuf {
00027 public:
00028     const static int SHIFT_NONE = 0;
00029     const static int SHIFT_DAY = 1;
00030     const static int SHIFT_MONTH = 2;
00031     static const char EOL = '\n';
00032 
00033 public:
00034     LogFileBuf(std::string const& file_prefix, int shift_type) :
00035         _shift_type(shift_type), _file_prefix(file_prefix) {
00036             Open();
00037             if (IsOpen()) TraverseAndMove();
00038         }
00039 
00040     virtual int overflow(int c) override {
00041         if (c == EOL) {
00042             _file_buf.pubsync();
00043             if (Shift()) Open();
00044         }
00045         return _file_buf.sputc(c);
00046     }
00047 
00048     bool IsOpen() const { return _file_buf.is_open(); }
00049 
00050 protected:
00051     void Open() {
00052         // save last
00053         lsf::util::Date date;
00054         switch (_shift_type) {
00055             case SHIFT_NONE:  break;
00056             case SHIFT_DAY:   _last_shift_val = date.GetDay();   break;
00057             case SHIFT_MONTH: _last_shift_val = date.GetMonth(); break;
00058             default: return;
00059         }
00060 
00061         // construct path
00062         _file_path = _file_prefix + date.ToFormatString(".%Y-%m-%d");
00063 
00064         // mkdir if necessary
00065         auto file_dir = lsf::util::StringExt::GetDirName(_file_path);
00066         if (!lsf::util::System::IsExist(file_dir) && !lsf::util::System::MkDir(file_dir)) return;
00067 
00068         // open file
00069         if (_file_buf.is_open()) _file_buf.close();
00070         _file_buf.open(_file_path.c_str(), std::ios::app | std::ios::out);
00071     }
00072 
00073     bool Shift() {
00074         // check file exist
00075         if (!IsOpen()) return false;
00076 
00077         // check need shift
00078         switch (_shift_type) {
00079             case SHIFT_DAY:   if (_last_shift_val == (int)lsf::util::Date().GetDay())   return false; break;
00080             case SHIFT_MONTH: if (_last_shift_val == (int)lsf::util::Date().GetMonth()) return false; break;
00081             default: return false;
00082         }
00083 
00084         // real shift
00085         if (!RealShift(_file_path)) return false;
00086 
00087         // close old file
00088         _file_buf.close();
00089         return true;
00090     }
00091 
00092     bool RealShift(std::string const& file) {
00093         // check head match
00094         if (::strncmp(file.c_str(), _file_prefix.c_str(), _file_prefix.size()) != 0) return false;
00095 
00096         // scanf date
00097         unsigned int year, month, day;
00098         if (sscanf(file.c_str() + _file_prefix.size(), ".%u-%u-%u", &year, &month, &day) == EOF) return false;
00099 
00100         // check date match
00101         lsf::util::Date date;
00102         if (year == date.GetYear() && month == date.GetMonth() && day == date.GetDay()) return false;
00103 
00104         // calc new file path
00105         char const* nest_dir;
00106         switch (_shift_type) {
00107             case SHIFT_DAY:   nest_dir = "/%Y/%m/"; break;
00108             case SHIFT_MONTH: nest_dir = "/%Y/";    break;
00109             default: return false;
00110         }
00111         std::string new_file_path = lsf::util::StringExt::GetDirName(file) +
00112                         date.ToFormatString(nest_dir) +
00113                         lsf::util::StringExt::GetBaseName(file);
00114 
00115         // mkdir and rename
00116         auto new_file_dir = lsf::util::StringExt::GetDirName(new_file_path);
00117         if (!lsf::util::System::IsExist(new_file_dir) && !lsf::util::System::MkDir(new_file_dir)) return false;
00118         if (!lsf::util::System::Rename(file, new_file_path)) return false;
00119 
00120         return true;
00121     }
00122 
00123     void TraverseAndMove() {
00124         // traverse all file
00125         lsf::util::System::ForFilesWithinFold(
00126                 lsf::util::StringExt::GetDirName(_file_prefix),
00127                 [this] (std::string const& file) { RealShift(file); });
00128     }
00129 
00130 protected:
00131     int _shift_type = SHIFT_NONE;
00132     int _last_shift_val = -1;
00133     std::string _file_prefix;
00134     std::string _file_path;
00135     std::filebuf _file_buf;
00136 };
00137 
00139 // Log
00140 class Log : public std::ostream {
00141 public:
00142     const static int TYPE_INF = 0x1 << 0;
00143     const static int TYPE_DBG = 0x1 << 1;
00144     const static int TYPE_WRN = 0x1 << 2;
00145     const static int TYPE_ERR = 0x1 << 3;
00146     const static int TYPE_FAT = 0x1 << 4;
00147     const static int TYPE_ALL = TYPE_INF | TYPE_DBG | TYPE_WRN | TYPE_ERR | TYPE_FAT;
00148     const static size_t MAX_LOG_SIZE = 32768;
00149     using base_type = std::ostream;
00150 
00151 public:
00153     // common func
00154     Log(int mask = TYPE_ALL) : base_type(std::cerr.rdbuf()), _mask(mask) {}
00155     ~Log() { Release(); }
00156 
00157 
00158     void BingTerminalOut() { base_type::rdbuf(std::cout.rdbuf()); }
00159     void BingTerminalErr() { base_type::rdbuf(std::cerr.rdbuf()); }
00160     void BindString() { Reset(new std::stringbuf()); }
00161 
00162     bool BindFile(std::string const& file_prefix, int shift_type = LogFileBuf::SHIFT_NONE) {
00163         auto ptmp = new LogFileBuf(file_prefix, shift_type);
00164         if (!ptmp->IsOpen()) {
00165             delete ptmp;
00166             return false;
00167         }
00168 
00169         Reset(ptmp);
00170         return true;
00171     }
00172 
00173     std::string GetString() const {
00174         if (std::stringbuf* psb = dynamic_cast<std::stringbuf*>(base_type::rdbuf())) {
00175             return psb->str();
00176         }
00177         return "";
00178     }
00179 
00180     bool CheckMask(int type) const { return type & _mask; }
00181 
00183     // output func
00184     Log& Output(int type, char const* fmt, ...) {
00185         // check input
00186         if (!base_type::good()) return *this;
00187         if (!CheckMask(type)) return *this;
00188         if (fmt == nullptr) return *this;
00189 
00190         // get user-define content
00191         char tmp[MAX_LOG_SIZE];
00192         va_list ap;
00193         va_start(ap, fmt);
00194         vsnprintf(tmp, sizeof(tmp), fmt, ap);
00195         va_end(ap);
00196 
00197         // do ouotput
00198         base_type::write(tmp, strnlen(tmp, sizeof(tmp)));
00199         base_type::flush();
00200 
00201         return *this;
00202     }
00203 
00204 protected:
00205     void Release() {
00206         if (_psb) delete _psb;
00207     }
00208 
00209     void Reset(std::streambuf* psb) {
00210         Release();
00211         _psb = psb;
00212         base_type::rdbuf(_psb);
00213     }
00214 
00215     int _mask = TYPE_ALL;
00216     std::streambuf* _psb = nullptr;
00217 };
00218 
00220 // SingleLog
00221 class SingleLog : public Log, public lsf::basic::Singleton<SingleLog> { };
00222 
00223 } // end namespace util
00224 } // end namespace lsf

00227 // macros
00228 #define LSF_LOG             lsf::util::SingleLog::Reference()
00229 #define LSF_DATE            lsf::util::Date::Now().ToFormatString("%Y-%m-%d|%H:%M:%S")
00230 #define LSF_STACK(count)    lsf::util::Backtrace::Instance()->ToString(5).c_str()
00231 #define LSF_PROTOBUF        lsf::util::Protobuf::Instance()->ErrString().c_str()
00232 
00233 #define LSF_LOG_INF(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG.Output(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_INF, "%s|INF " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " " fmt "\n", LSF_DATE.c_str(), ##__VA_ARGS__)
00234 #define LSF_LOG_DBG(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG.Output(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_DBG, "%s|DBG " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " " fmt "\n", LSF_DATE.c_str(), ##__VA_ARGS__)
00235 #define LSF_LOG_WRN(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG.Output(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_WRN, "%s|WRN " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " " fmt "\n", LSF_DATE.c_str(), ##__VA_ARGS__)
00236 #define LSF_LOG_ERR(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG.Output(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_ERR, "%s|ERR " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " " fmt "\n", LSF_DATE.c_str(), ##__VA_ARGS__)
00237 #define LSF_LOG_FAT(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG.Output(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_FAT, "%s|FAT " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " " fmt "\n", LSF_DATE.c_str(), ##__VA_ARGS__)
00238 
00239 #define LSF_LOG_INF_STACK(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG_INF(fmt "\n%s", ##__VA_ARGS__, LSF_STACK(5))
00240 #define LSF_LOG_DBG_STACK(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG_DBG(fmt "\n%s", ##__VA_ARGS__, LSF_STACK(5))
00241 #define LSF_LOG_WRN_STACK(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG_WRN(fmt "\n%s", ##__VA_ARGS__, LSF_STACK(5))
00242 #define LSF_LOG_ERR_STACK(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG_ERR(fmt "\n%s", ##__VA_ARGS__, LSF_STACK(5))
00243 #define LSF_LOG_FAT_STACK(fmt, ...) LSF_LOG_FAT(fmt "\n%s", ##__VA_ARGS__, LSF_STACK(5))
00244 
00245 #define LSF_INF if (LSF_LOG.CheckMask(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_INF)) LSF_LOG << LSF_DATE << "|INF " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " "
00246 #define LSF_DBG if (LSF_LOG.CheckMask(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_DBG)) LSF_LOG << LSF_DATE << "|DBG " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " "
00247 #define LSF_WRN if (LSF_LOG.CheckMask(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_WRN)) LSF_LOG << LSF_DATE << "|WRN " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " "
00248 #define LSF_ERR if (LSF_LOG.CheckMask(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_ERR)) LSF_LOG << LSF_DATE << "|ERR " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " "
00249 #define LSF_FAT if (LSF_LOG.CheckMask(lsf::util::Log::TYPE_FAT)) LSF_LOG << LSF_DATE << "|FAT " __FILE__ "|" LSF_TOKEN_TO_STRING(__LINE__) " "
